definition: to relinquish one's grip/to let go
loose/to loosen/to relax/floss (dry, fluffy food product made from shredded, seasoned meat or fish, used as a topping or filling)
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: They gaudio-videoe up their holidays in order to fulfill their work plan.
sentences.chinese: 为了实行这个工作计划，他们松手了假期。

sentences.english: Before you pull a tick off Fido, dab the critter with rubbing alcohol to make it loosen its grip.
sentences.chinese: 在你抓虱子之前，用酒精轻轻拍一下它，让其松手。

sentences.english: So long as a leaf can stay up it mustn't let go.
sentences.chinese: 一片树叶只要能留在树上就不应该松手往下掉。

sentences.english: Why would you want to keep your emotions at arms length?
sentences.chinese: 痛苦是因为你抓得太牢不想松手。

sentences.english: Pain is where you hold on too tightly.
sentences.chinese: 痛苦是因为你抓得太牢不想松手。

sentences.english: I told him not to let go, but he said it was time.
sentences.chinese: 我叫他扶着车子别松手，他却说是时候了。

definition: to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
to let go of sth/to give up
to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
to reach out with one's hand/to hold out a hand/(fig.) to beg/to get involved/to meddle
to swing one's arms/to wash one's hands of sth
